alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 9:23PM CDT until July 17 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pulaski County in southern Illinois... Eastern Alexander County in southern Illinois... Western Hickman County in western Kentucky... Northwestern Carlisle County in western Kentucky... Ballard County in western Kentucky... Mississippi County in southeastern Missouri... Northeastern New Madrid County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 923 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ware to Tamms to near Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area to near Miner to near New Madrid, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Mounds and Mound City around 935 PM CDT. Charleston and Cairo around 940 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include East Prairie, Big Oak Tree State Park, Wickliffe, Anniston, Barlow, Wyatt, Dorena, La Center and Bardwell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 22. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 2 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 46 and 62. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
